Issues.Title: Change detection not run when the errors are set on reactive forms
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/forms.... ### Is this a regression? Not sure. ### Description I am on angular 7 and i am using reactive forms for one of my forms and the code is as below. (Stackblitz [Here][1]) **Template**
Error
**Typescript** export class AppComponent implements OnInit { SignupForm: FormGroup; constructor() { } ngOnInit() { setTimeout(() => { this.SignupForm = new FormGroup({ 'username': new FormControl('Value'), 'email': new FormControl() }); this.SignupForm.setErrors({errors: 'Error'}); }) } } As you can see i am trying to set the error as soon as the form is initialized (In my actual case i would do some validation based on back end data and then do this. ). But the error doesn't seem to show up even though `SignupForm.errors` is set with the error object. But if i do setTimeout(() => { this.SignupForm.setErrors({errors: 'Error'});}) Everything works fine. Am i doing something wrong or is it an angular bug which i can report. Please help. Thank you. [1]: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-forms-bug?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts **Use case** Actually the thing is my form comes from the backend which is asynchronous. After the i create the form group from the metadata i do the validation and set the errors. I have used setTimeout on ngOnInit just to depict its asynchronous. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-forms-bug?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** "@angular/common": "^7.2.5", "@angular/compiler": "^7.2.5", "@angular/core": "^7.2.5", "@angular/forms": "^7.2.5", "@angular/platform-browser": "^7.2.5", "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^7.2.5", "@angular/router": "^7.2.5", "core-js": "^2.6.5", "rxjs": "^6.4.0", "zone.js": "^0.8.29"
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Change detection not run when the errors are set on reactive forms" (#29515)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): generate empty QueryList for root component content queries
Issues.Body:
In View Engine, we used to generate empty QueryLists for content queries on root
components (though we did not actually support populating these lists). We need
to keep this behavior in Ivy for backwards compatibility. Otherwise, components
that are sometimes used as root will fail if they are relying on content query
results to always be defined.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): generate empty QueryList for root component content queries" (#29514)

Issues.Title: Input checked attribute is not present in markup
Issues.Body:
Dear,

# üêû bug report
Checkbox checked attribute is not set.

Not sure

angular 7.2.10

This might look like a cosmetic issue, however, it is blocking our QUA team from validating the behavior of our app.

Thanks for consideration.

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

I‚Äôm very glad that we have a Guide for `app-shell` now (https://next.angular.io/guide/app-shell via https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/28591)! However, it seems less polished than some of the other guides.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://next.angular.io/guide/app-shell

### Reproduction Steps**

- Typos like ‚ÄúFor an existing application, you have to manually add the RouterModule and **defining** a <router-outlet>‚Äú.
- It seems like there should be a `Step 1a` and `Step 1b` with example snippets for an existing application
- For `Step 2`
  - `my-app` takes the name of your client application.
  - `server-app` takes the name of the Universal (or server) application.
  - These seem to be just repeating what‚Äôs on the command line example above. Should we be referencing the `--client-project` and `--universal-project` instead of `my-app` and `server-app` here?
  - It seems like there needs to be more explanation of where a developer would go to find these names.
- `Step 3` helps you verify that `ng run app-shell` works, but what about `Step 4` where you integrate this with your normal build, deploy, and verify this? If that gets too complicated, is there a section in the Universal docs that we should be pointing them to?
  - i.e. do they run that before or after `ng run my-app:app-shell`? should they do something like this? `"build:prod": "ng build --prod && ng run my-app:app-shell",`
  - or does `ng build --prod` already handle this and they don‚Äôt need to know about `ng run my-app:app-shell`?

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
See above.


## üì∑Screenshot
N/A


## üî• Exception or Error
N/A


## üåç  Your Environment

Chrome 73

Issues.Title: ngFor over complex data does not work for custom-elements in IE and Edge (freeze)
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package `@angular/core` ### Is this a regression? Not testet in older Version ### Description If you iterate over a complex array (array consisting of Objects) on an custom-element with *ngFor and the custom element deffers a render/update in a task or microtask angular freezes on IE11 and Edge. If you iterate over an array of basic-types everything works fine. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Repository to reproduce: https://github.com/mzeiher/ngFor-custom-element-bug Custom Elements defined here (one which renders directly, one defers render to a microtask, one defers render to a setTimeout): https://github.com/mzeiher/ngFor-custom-element-bug/blob/master/src/app/app.component.ts Angular Template: https://github.com/mzeiher/ngFor-custom-element-bug/blob/master/src/app/app.component.html just run `npm start`, un-comment line 5 and 6 in `app.component.html` and startup Edge or Internet Explorer 11. The page freezes, looks like the renderer is stuck in an endless loop (if the render is defered to a microtask the browser obviously freezes, if defered to a setTimeout the render just re-renders in an endless loop) ## üî• Exception or Error 

IE11 and Edge freeze, renderer stuck in endless loop
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.3.6
Node: 11.12.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.10
Source code is ES5, @webcomponents/webcomponentsjs polyfill is loaded for Edge and IE If you need more code sample just let me know it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ngFor over complex data does not work for custom-elements in IE and Edge (freeze)" (#29510)

Issues.Title: Angular animation: :enter & :leave have non-symmetric behavior
Issues.Body:
### Affected Package
@angular/animations

### Description
:enter animation works, while :leave does not for child components of *ngFor
I believe that the behavior should be symmetric.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qcqfdk?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

## üåç  Your Environment
Chrome 73

**Angular Version:**
7.2.5

**Anything else relevant?**
There is a workaround to make :leave animation to work by adding 
` trigger('animateChild', [
      transition(':enter, :leave', [query('@*', animateChild())])
    ]),`
trigger either to *ngFor or to a child component.

or by moving animation trigger from the child component to the *ngFor element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular animation: :enter & :leave have non-symmetric behavior" (#29509)

Issues.Title: fix(core): static-query schematic should detect queries in "ngDoCheck" and "ngOnChanges"
Issues.Body:

In order to properly detect all queries, we need to also respect these lifecycle hooks.

Resolves FW-1192

Issues.Title: Document difference between EventEmitter and Subject
Issues.Body:
There is no documentation about the difference between `Subject` and `EventEmitter`. AFAIK, the only differences are EventEmitter's duplicative `emit()` and optional asynchronous mode.

Of the two, `Subject` is shorter, better documented, and is not unique to Angular, so I always prefer `Subject`.

I have no idea if I am getting something important wrong by doing this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Document difference between EventEmitter and Subject" (#29499)

Issues.Title: navigationId inside RouteReuseStrategy
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
@angular/router

### Description
I would like to have the navigationId available inside the RouteReuseStrategy to create a stack of pages.
The use case: Suppose I have a page that I can use to search a specific contact. I select contactttype "Accountmanager" and I know the CEO of the company he works for. So from this page I jump to a page to lookup a company. I don't know the company-name but I know the CEO. So from this page I jump to lookup a contact. I find the CEO, i hit "select". I come back in the page to lookup a company and the CEO is shown in the filter. I find my company, I hit select and I come back in the page to find contacts. My selection "Account Manager" is still present and the company name is added to the filter.
I want these pages to be stored in my RouteReuseStrategy but I can't use the URL because it's not unique.
My application is thus a stack of pages. While looking for information I open new pages in the same browserwindow that are added to the stack and as i find stuff I pop the pages from the stack, but the URL cannot be used to identify these pages.

### Describe the solution you'd like
I would like to use the navigationId to create a map of DetachedRouteHandle so I would like this parameter to be passed to the methods of the RouteReuseStrategy interface.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I could add an id to every URL to simulate the navigationId but that seems awkward.
I've tried to access the navigationId from ActivatedRouteSnapshot but I cannot obtain it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "navigationId inside RouteReuseStrategy" (#29498)

Issues.Title: Angular animation :leave not triggered
Issues.Body:
I have a tooltip component with animations in which the `:enter` animation is working as expected but the `:leave` animation never triggered.

Here is a link to stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/building-tooltip-eoby9e?file=src/app/tooltip/tooltip.component.ts

```
  animations: [
    trigger('tooltip', [
      transition(':enter', [
        style({ opacity: 0 }),
        animate(300, style({ opacity: 1 })),
      ]),
      transition(':leave', [
        animate(300, style({ opacity: 0 })),
      ]),
    ]),
  ],
```

Angular version: 7.1.4

Issues.Title: Telemetry various fix
Issues.Body:
The prompt was never shown to the user because of a combination of issues;

1. the "scripts" key in package.json is not kept during building.
1. when a user lack a global configuration file, we return as if the user answered false (because it's `null`, not `undefined`).
1. prompting on non-tty terminals also meant that CI was broken.

This fixes those issues.

Issues.Title: Angular CLI doesn't detect changes/references in files used by importing 'index.ts' in angular and don't recompiling project
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description In AppComponent the IPerson1 interface is imported by index. Probably visual studio doesn't detect references to the file and doesn't recompile the project when changing and saving the file. The interface "IPerson2" is imported directly and recompile works. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. Create Angular project 2. Add new folder "person" 3. Add file iperson1.ts to "person" folder ``` export interface IPerson1 { name: string; age: number; } ``` 4. Add file IPerson2 to "person" folder ``` export interface iperson2.ts { name: string; age: number; } ``` 5. Add ile index.ts to "person" folder ``` export * from './iperson'; export * from './iperson2'; ``` 6. Add this code to AppComponent: ``` import { IPerson1 } from './person'; import { IPerson2 } from './person/iperson2'; ``` ``` person: IPerson1 = { age: 20, name: 'Karl' }; person2: IPerson2 = { age: 21, name: 'Tomas' }; ``` 7. Start project: _npm start_ 8. Change something in iperson1.ts and save. Project is not recompiled. 9. Change something in iperson2.ts and save. Project is recompiled. ![vscode2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5776195/53482781-4fc44b00-3a80-11e9-9cc9-66f981f4f09c.gif) ## üåç Your Environment

Node: 10.15.1
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.6

Issues.Title: Angular Dev Kit 8.x.x: make server and karma builder reusable by external developers
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [x] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
The new Architect API is almost here and it takes into consideration external developers such as myself (@hansl great job!).  
For instance, there is `transforms` object in [browser](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/browser/index2.ts#L212) and [dev-server](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/dev-server/index2.ts#L77) builders which allows me to easily extend them with custom webpack configuration ([custom-webpack:browser](https://github.com/meltedspark/angular-builders/blob/new-architect-api/packages/custom-webpack/src/browser/index2.ts), [custom-webpack:dev-server](https://github.com/meltedspark/angular-builders/blob/new-architect-api/packages/custom-webpack/src/dev-server/index.ts)).  
It made the transition from 7.x.x to 8.x.x very easy end the API itself is very robust.  
However, this is not the case for karma and server builders (which are must-have to complete the transition).   
The only function I can reuse from [server](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/server/index2.ts) builder is [`buildServerWebpackConfig`](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/server/index2.ts#L107) but even with this reuse I have to copy&modify the rest of the logic.  
When it comes to [karma](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/karma/index2.ts) builder I don't think I can reuse anything from there, meaning I have to copy&modify the whole file.  

### Describe the solution you'd like
Karma and Server builders should provide the same level of flexibility and behave similarly to Browser and Dev-Server builders.  
In particular, take in the `transforms` object, export the logic that can be potentially reused by external developers and use the same way for creating a builder (`createBuilder` function from `'@angular-devkit/architect/src/index2'` and not something custom like [here](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/server/index2.ts#L44)).
### Describe alternatives you've considered
The only alternative I have today is to copy and paste the code from Karma and Server builder and start modifying it.  
I hope we all agree that this is very hard to maintain and can't be a long term option.  
In fact, it would be really great if I didn't have to do it and I could reuse all the necessary logic before the RC is out.  

@clydin @mgechev Guys, @hansl told me that I should ask you for help about the coordination so here I'm asking.  
We can discuss it here, or if you need more details I'm on `#tools-friends` channel at Slack.

Thanks a lot for doing such an amazing job!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Dev Kit 8.x.x: make server and karma builder reusable by external developers" (#13972)

Issues.Title: fileReplacements cannot replace app.module.ts (ng build --configuration=production)
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [X] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Not sure. hadn't tried this before ### Description fileReplacements cannot replace app.module.ts command used: ng build --configuration=production got this error: ERROR in : Type AppComponent in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts is part of the declarations of 2 modules: AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts! Please consider moving AppComponent in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts to a higher module that imports AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts. You can also create a new NgModule that exports and includes AppComponent in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts then import that NgModule in AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Simple steps to reproduce this bug. 1. Create a new project using `ng new`. 2. Create two components `ng g c app/components/home` `ng g c app/components/feature`. 3. Make a copy of app.module.ts file and name it app.module.prod.ts file. 4. Remove `import { FeatureComponent } from './app/components/feature/feature.component';` from app.module.prod.ts. Reason is feature component is not needed in production. 5. Run `ng build --configuration=production` You can clone the following repo and run `ng build --configuration=production` https://github.com/Jun711/replaceAppModule ## üî• Exception or Error 
/Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts is part of the declarations of 2 modules: AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts! Please consider moving AppComponent in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts to a higher module that imports AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts. You can also create a new NgModule that exports and includes AppComponent in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.component.ts then import that NgModule in AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.ts and AppModule in /Users/j/Projects/replaceAppModule/src/app/app.module.prod.ts.

- feat(@schematics/angular): remove ivy-ngcc postinstall script from new application
- refactor(@ngtools/webpack): move interfaces to separate file
This is to avoid circular imports

- feat(@ngtools/webpack): add NGCC as part of the workflow  ‚Ä¶
When add module is resolved, it will try to convert the module using the `NGCC` API. Also, this add a helper method `getMainFields` to be used externally to compute that mainFields based on several criteria s such as Platform, enableIvy and Script Target.

- test: add e2e test for ivy opt-out

- refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use `@ngtools/webpack` getMainFields helper

Issues.Title: raw-loader not working with "aot": true and "buildOptimizer": true
Issues.Body:
Currently in my components I have code like 
```
import * as leftMenuTemplate from '!raw-loader!./templates/_left-menu.html';

@Component({
selector: 'my-component',
template: `
    <aside class="main-sidebar">
      <section class="sidebar">${leftMenuTemplate}</section>
    </aside>
   `
})
```
everything works fine if I build with  "aot": false and "buildOptimizer": false but everything fails if I build with "aot": true and "buildOptimizer": true

**_When I try to run with AOT true I get the null string rendered instead of my menu._**

Issues.Title: Call ng [serve | build] with a platform flag
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

It would be great to be able to add extensions to `ng serve` and `ng build`, which would allow me to call a custom serve/build mechanism.

This would be very useful with NativeScript where the developers need to use two CLIs, the Angular CLI for generating components, services etc. and the NativeScript to build and deploy the apps.

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...

When I am in a NativeScript Angular project (or a code-sharing project web+mobile), it would be great to be able to call something like:
`ng serve --ios` or `ng serve --flag=android`, which would then ask the architect on how to perform the build iOS or Android build and deploy the app.

It would also be great to do the same with `ng build --ios`, which would perform a full mobile build.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.

What I am looking after is a mechanism that would allow me to plug into the Angular CLI, and then extend it with additional build options.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Call ng [serve | build] with a platform flag" (#13959)

Closes https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/9733

Issues.Title: checkbox ID has increment BUG
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
when click checkbox it gets checked


#### What is the current behavior?
when click checkbox the next adjacent checkbox gets checked

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
sorry no repo


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
latest

#### Is there anything else we should know?
its been in the code for past year

I have bit the bullet to isolate it finally

after chomping on inputs [ngModel] and [checked]
and crafting all the ways of doing ID's

I omitted all

and allowed material 2 to generate its own ID

and when I align my bitset of bits to retain state of all my checkboxes
the bitset reflects 0..n checkboxes fines and state is retained check and uncheck

but the markup is NOT being checked by material

I figured ID's generated for each checkbox would start with indice 0

to align with my bitset 0..10

only to find someone coded material to generate internal ID's

so when I check my checkbox 0 of 0..10

id's internally are generated mat-checkbox-1, mat-checkbox-2, mat-checkbox-3, ... N

and everytime I check my first checkbox

the subsequent next checkbox is the one being checked on my user interface component template


if someone could fix this

I do not have a workaround for am working on trying that now but have not gotten a workaround

refer to code like this in material

  private _uniqueId: string = `mat-checkbox-${++nextUniqueId}`;

either they are not considering indice 0
or they are pre-incrementing it errantly on the active checkbox instance
either way material checkbox not working and im surprised this hasnt been flagged yet
their ID logic IS being operated on internally in order to determine which checkbox gets checked
thats where the fix needs to be performed

a workaround would be appreciated


here are some snippets

```
                <mat-checkbox *ngFor="let bit of bits.getArray(); let i = index"
                              [labelPosition]="'after'"
                              class="example-margin"
                              (change)="onCheck($event)"
                >
                    {{i}}
                </mat-checkbox>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "checkbox ID has increment BUG" (#15602)

Issues.Body:

The rows expand like they do on Chrome and Firefox

Issues.Title: Drag-and-drop disabled inputs not working
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

Drap-and-drop of disabled elements should be possible. Drag-and-drop should only be disabled by [cdkDragDisabled], not by the HTML "disabled" attribute.

#### What is the current behavior?

**cdkDrag on inputs**

- With cdkDrag on inputs, drag-and-drop is working as expected.
- With cdkDrag and cdkDragDisabled on inputs, drag-and-drop is blocked as expected.
- With cdkDrag on **disabled** inputs (HTML disabled attribute), drag-and-drop is **not** working. **This is not what I did expect according to the CDK documentation** which states drag-and-drop is disabled by [cdkDragDisabled].

**cdkDrag on a div wrapping inputs**

- With cdkDrag on a div wrapping inputs, drag-and-drop is working as expected.
- With cdkDrag on a div wrapping **disabled** inputs (HTML disabled attribute), drag-and-drop is working on Chrome and Internet Explorer. However, it is NOT working on Firefox and Edge. The behavior is here **inconsistent across browsers**.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

Here is a stackblitz project to reproduce these 5 different cases : 
[https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dhlkfm](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dhlkfm)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Angular 7.2.10, CDK 7.3.5, Material 7.3.5, TypeScript 3.2.4.

Browsers used for these tests (all desktop Win10 versions) :

- Chrome 72
- Firefox 66
- Microsoft EdgeHTML 17.17134
- Internet Explorer 17.648.17134.0

#### Is there anything else we should know?

I've got bad news : your Google Chrome browser behavior is identical to the very-old-and-obsolete Internet Explorer :-)

Beside this joke, I'm using drag-and-drop to let the app user configure which fields of a search bar are displayed and which are not. During the "configuration" mode (which is enabling drag-and-drop), I do not want the user to be able to enter values within the search inputs. For this reason, I need the input fields to be disabled during this configuration process.

I could not think about much options to work around this problem. The only option I can think of is to add a drag handle within the div wrapper, but this means my drag-and-drop elements are increasing in size, which I would rather avoid if possible.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Drag-and-drop disabled inputs not working" (#15592)

Issues.Title: material button toggle/ switch between two icons.
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

Buttons are often used to toggle state. Toggling state often comes with the need of changing the icon inside the button.
this
`<button (click)="toggleState = !toggleState" mat-button>{{ toggleState ? 'more_vert' : 'more_horiz' }}</button>`

Does not work for obvious reasons.

instead I would have to go caveman style:

`<button *ngIf="toggleState" (click)="toggleState = !toggleState" mat-button>more_vert</button>
<button *ngIf="!toggleState" (click)="toggleState = !toggleState" mat-button>more_horiz</button>`

Would be cool to have something like this:

`<button #button (click)="toggleState = !toggleState; button.toggleIcon()" secondIcon="more_horiz" mat-button>more_vert</button>`

(if possible a "transition" animation from icon to icon could happen. I know that's a tough one since "svg nodes" need to line up beween icons etc ...)



#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?


#### Is there anything else we should know?

Issues.Title: mat-form-fields not matching Material color specs for hovering
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
According to the latest version of the Google Material spec, hovering for "fill" inputs should be 1dp/grey-700 and for "outline" inputs 1dp/grey-300.

#### What is the current behavior?
For elements using mat-form-field with appearance="fill", "standard" or "outline", the hover-state border is 2dp/rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.87). This is significantly darker than the specification color and has the wrong weight.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
This current behavior should be readily visible in any mat-form-field that uses any of the 3 aforementioned appearances.

Here is the example usage from the Angular Material site.
https://stackblitz.com/angular/epjajgjbbve?file=app%2Fform-field-appearance-example.ts


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular Material: 7.3.5
Chrome: 72.0.3626.121 (should still be reproducible on others)
OS: Linux (should still be reproducible on others)

"dependencies": {
    "@angular/animations": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/common": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/compiler": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/core": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/elements": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/forms": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "8.0.0-beta.6",
    "@webcomponents/custom-elements": "^1.1.0",
    "core-js": "^2.6.1",
    "rxjs": "^6.4.0",
    "systemjs": "0.19.43",
    "tsickle": "^0.34.0",
    "tslib": "^1.9.3",
    "zone.js": "^0.8.29"
  },

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This has already been discussed beforehand with @mmalerba.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-form-fields not matching Material color specs for hovering" (#15583)

Issues.Title: Angular Material Typography using pixels instead of rem
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
When using Angular's Typography inside '_theming.scss' ends up using pixels. I believe the best would be for this to instead convert the pixels to 'rem'. 

Rem is very important when it comes to accessibility concerns. If the user goes to the browser settings and changes the font size to very large the text in the application should scale accordingly.

As 'rem' is much stronger than pixels when it comes to accessibility I am a bit surprised this is not implemented in this manner. I believe this change would only make a positive impact, currently I am in the debate of using this because of this problem as we will be then failing some accessibility guidelines. 

#### What is the expected behavior?
The text in the application after using Angular's Typography should be converting pixels provided to rem for accessibility for when the user goes to adjust the browsers font size from medium (default) to another such as large.

#### What is the current behavior?
Angular Typography uses pixels. This prevents the application font-size from scaling when the user has trouble seeing and wishes to scale the font size up through the browser.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
 1. Create new Angular Application
 2. Add Angular Material Typography to the application with default values provided by the Angular guide [here](https://material.angular.io/guide/typography)
 3. In your app components html add a simple h1 with typography class added:
    <h1 class="mat-display-1">Header Text For Testing<h1 class="mat-display-1">
 4. Inspect the h1 tag through Google Chrome
 5. You will see something similar to this: 400 34px/40px Roboto, "Helvetica Neue", sans-serif;

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Accessibility 

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
All

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Accessibility is an important part of an application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Material Typography using pixels instead of rem" (#15580)

Issues.Title: MatDialog not working properly on pageload on NgUniversal (ssr)
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
MatDialog should behave the same on a ssr application

#### What is the current behavior?
On SSR, when MatDialog is triggered (`this.dialog.open()`) on **pageload** (`ngOnInit`) two `<cdk-overlay-container>` is generated in the DOM. When trying to close it (`this.dialog.close()`) only one instance is responding to it. The other one still remain in the DOM. Which leaves the user with a dialog on the screen which can not been closed.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Run your app on SSR, open MatDialog on ngOnInit.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
```
"@angular-devkit/build-angular": "^0.10.1",
"@angular/animations": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/cdk": "^7.3.0",
"@angular/cli": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/common": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/compiler": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/compiler-cli": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/core": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/flex-layout": "^7.0.0-beta.19",
"@angular/forms": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/http": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/material": "^7.3.0",
"@angular/platform-browser": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/platform-server": "^7.0.0",
"@angular/router": "^7.0.0",
"@nguniversal/express-engine": "^7.0.2",
"@nguniversal/module-map-ngfactory-loader": "^7.0.0"
```

MacOS Mojave (10.14.3)
Typescript 3.1.x
Node 10.13.0
Yarn 1.10.0

Affects all browsers

#### Is there anything else we should know?
-
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatDialog not working properly on pageload on NgUniversal (ssr)" (#15579)

Issues.Title: Clicking autocomplete field after clear doesn't show dropdown list
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Clicking the cleared autocomplete input field should show the dropdown list.

#### What is the current behavior?
After clearing the autocomplete field using a clear button that sets the input value to null or '', clicking the cleared input field will not show the dropdown list. The dropdown list will show if the user clicks the label above the input field, clicks very close to the top side of the input line, or clicks away from the input then back into the input field. 

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-srhd19?embed=1&file=app/autocomplete-simple-example.html
1. Select an item from the list.
2. Use the clear button to clear the input.
3. Click in the middle of the input field, then notice nothing happen.
![autocompleteClickWorkaround](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11539520/54828279-d1735700-4c81-11e9-89a0-240c36fba1ea.gif)

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular6, Material 6.4.7 and 7.2.0, Windows 7 and Linux, Firefox 60.5.2, Chrome 72.0.3626.121

#### Is there anything else we should know?
The user can enter a character or select up or down arrows to force the dropdown list to open after input has been cleared.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Clicking autocomplete field after clear doesn't show dropdown list" (#15577)
